title: Bobby Riggs
summary: Robert Larimore Riggs (February 25, 1918 – October 25, 1995)[4] was an American tennis champion who was the World No. 1 or the World co-No. 1 player for three years, first as an amateur in 1939, then as a professional in 1946 and 1947.[3] He played his first professional tennis match on December 26, 1941.
